Manchas de óleo voltam a aparecer em Stella Maris e na Praia do Flamengo
Já foram retiradas mais de 108 toneladas de petróleo das praias de Salvador
01 Nov 2019, 16:15 by Redação
Novas manchas de óleo reapareceram em dois trechos de praias de Salvador nesta sexta-feira (1). As manchas foram constatadas nas proximidades da Escola Sulamerican, na Praia do Flamengo, e do Grand Hotel Stella Maris, no bairro de mesmo nome. Mais de 75 agentes de limpeza estão trabalhando na limpeza do óleo no local. 
Desde o dia 18 de outubro, não havia registro da chegada desse resíduo na  orla soteropolitana. A Empresa de Limpeza Urbana de Salvador (Limpurb) informou que as equipes estão de prontidão para agir de imediato e garantir a limpeza das praias da capital baiana. 
Os dados atualizados de hoje serão informados no fim do dia. A Limpurb informa que até hoje (1º), já foram retiradas mais de 108 toneladas de petróleo das praias de Salvador.

Oil stains reappear on Stella Maris and Flamengo Beach
More than 108 tons of oil have been removed from the beaches of Salvador
01 Nov 2019, 16:15 by Writing
New oil slicks reappeared on two stretches of beaches in Salvador on Friday (1). The spots were found near the Sulamerican School, at Flamengo Beach, and the Grand Hotel Stella Maris, in the neighborhood of the same name. More than 75 cleaning agents are working on on-site oil cleaning.
Since October 18, there was no record of the arrival of this residue on the soteropolitana border. Salvador Urban Cleaning Company (Limpurb) informed that the teams are ready to act immediately and ensure the cleanliness of the beaches of the Bahian capital.
Today's updated data will be reported later in the day. Limpurb informs that until today (1st), more than 108 tons of oil have been removed from the beaches of Salvador.
